Description: Rim sherd (mended from three fragments with added plaster) of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; from top: dot and billet frieze in added white between white bands; frieze of buds in white outline with added red centres; white dot and billet pattern; white tongue; exterior: row of dots at top of rim above band of Z between pairs of lines; below, painted decoration consisting of sphinx seated to left (part of face and forelegs missing; red stroke on body); below, chequer band between pairs of lines.
Curator's comments: A865 is written on a label on the exterior of the sherd; 864 and 865 pencilled on inside of separate sherds. For parallels, see British Museum 1924,1201.593.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 298, no. 992.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1964) (phase 2)
